Yes, there are other measures that the government could take to further improve air quality in São Paulo. Here are some suggestions:

1. Promote renewable energy - São Paulo could stimulate the transition to renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind, and reduce dependence on fossil fuels.

2. Expand public transportation - The city could work to expand and improve public transportation infrastructure, including more subway and rail lines, to make it more accessible and efficient for commuters.

3. Encourage telecommuting - The city could encourage companies to adopt policies that allow for telecommuting or remote work to reduce the number of cars on the road.

4. Plant more trees - The government could work to plant more trees throughout the city, which can help absorb pollutants and improve air quality.

5. Increase public awareness - São Paulo could invest more in public education campaigns to raise awareness of the impacts of air pollution and promote individual actions that can help reduce it.

These measures, along with continued efforts to promote low-emission policies and reduce industrial pollution, could further improve air quality in São Paulo.
